title: Bamboo Leaf Wrap (Dong)
description: Also known as Chinese sushi. Rice wrapped in bamboo leaves with a tasty salted egg inside.
instructions: Boil bamboo leaves for half an hour. Wash each leaf. Set out to dry (but not completely).
Wash rice. Add some salt, chicken powder, oil, and peanuts. Mix all together.
Take two leaves and make them into a cup shape. Scoop the seasoned rice into it. Add the egg and meat. Add some more rice on top.
Take one or two leaves to close off the cup. Tie together with a string.
Boil the leaf wraps for at least three hours. Refill the water as needed.

title: Dumpling (Jiao Zi/Gao Du)
description: The dish that Meanz always eats. Tastes bests with a spicy dumpling sauce.

title: Fried Noodles (Chao Mian)
description: Very crunchy and salty. A good meal perfect for lazy days.

title: Onion Pancakes (Tong Biang)
description: Food in its peak form. A perfect mix of chewy, salty, and oniony to make the best pancakes ever.

title: Rice Noodle Rolls (Chang Fen)
description: A very delicious type of noodle.

title: Sushi (Shou Si)
description: The easiest food for Mudz to eat. The best 'lazy' food.

title: Steamed Buns (Man Tou)
description: Very delicious and comforting food. Can be made to look extremely beautiful and presentable.

title: Fried Rice (Chao Fan)
description: The best fried rice dish available anywhere.

title: Rice Ball Noodles (Tang Yuan)
description: The best type of noodles. Comes in bite-sized, chewy balls.

title: Vinegar Eggs (Cu Dan)
description: The most delicious way to cook eggs. Flavorful burst that's good with rice or alone.

title: Rice Cakes (Nian Gao)
description: A great and unique way to eat rice.
